key_points: A Brazilian Senate committee approved a 1,100-page report on President Jair Bolsonaro's mishandling of the Covid-19 pandemic.
The report depicts Bolsonaro's disregard for science and human rights, which endangered Brazilian lives.
Over 600,000 Brazilians died from Covid-19; the report suggests many deaths could have been avoided.
Bolsonaro spread false Covid-19 information, opposed social distancing, and refused to wear masks.
His approach aimed for rapid contagion to achieve herd immunity, contravening World Health Organization recommendations.
In July 2020, Bolsonaro vetoed laws mandating mask use in churches and prisons.
A critical oxygen shortage in Amazonas led to several deaths, exacerbated by the government's inaction and distribution of ineffective drugs.
The government also neglected Indigenous populations, only drafting a Covid-19 protection plan after Supreme Court interventions.
Bolsonaro ignored vaccine offers from the Butantan Institute and failed to report suspected corruption in a vaccine deal.
The Senate report suggests criminal charges and impeachment for Bolsonaro, calling for serious examination by the attorney general.
